incidents.name: Lookup API Degraded Performance Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Lookup API Degraded Performance was degraded 01/15/2026, 08:37:00 PM UTC and 01/16/2026, 03:06:00 PM UTC. During this period of time customers may have experienced 1% of Lookup API V1 and Lookup API V2 increase in 404 errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Caller Id service failing to invoke the webhook when the method is GET. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: Minimal Customer Impact - Delay in Processing Inbound Email Messages in Conversations

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the delay in processing inbound email messages in Conversations and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a delay in processing Inbound Email Messages in Conversations. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: MMS Delivery Delays To and From a Subset of Twilio Numbers in Australia

incident_updates.body: We continue to observe latency in MMS delivery when sending messages to and from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia specially during the Australia peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. We have also identified MMS delivery failures to and from the impacted subset of Twilio Numbers in Australia. We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an on-going undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - MMS, APAC

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - MMS, APAC

incident_updates.body:
We continue to observe latency in MMS delivery reports sent from a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia to network subscribers, specially during the peak traffic between 14:00 until 20:00 PST. However the actual MMS are being delivered on time.

For the MMS from network subscribers to a subset of Twilio phone numbers in Australia, we are observing delivery delays.

We have identified that the primary cause of this latency is an on-going undersea cable fault. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Short Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We are still investigating an issue where some percentage of RCS messages are delayed. Our team has identified that the RCS service is returning permission denied errors, which is impacting message delivery for some of our customers. We are actively working to resolve this as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
